Subject: Successful XOR
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=186569417
X-Yahoo-Profile: lewinke67

My python implementation seems to be working.

Averages for 100 runs:

Average Generations        : 32.5
Average Number of Species  : 19.3 (Targeted to 18)
Average Hidden Nodes       :  3.9
Average Enabled Connectoins:  9.3

Seems like my average hidden nodes and enabled
connections are higher than others have reported.  I'm
not using exaclty the same parameters and reproduction
scheme though so that seems plausible. 

The good:

It seems to be working

Th bad:

It is slow

All in all it was a good exercise to help with my
understanding of the NEAT process and some of the nuts
and bolts details.  I'll probably work with it a
little more but am also going to start working with
one of the C++ implementations.

I'll post the code shortly.  Hopefully I don't have
any REALLYSTUPIDERRORS(tm) that I missed.
